projects.title: Fabric Defect Detection System
projects.description: Led the creation of a high-quality dataset for Fabric Defect Detection by collecting over 7,000 real-world images from textile factories. Personally conducted extensive manual annotation using class-specific defect labels, ensuring precision and consistency across the dataset. Developed a real-time CNN model inspired by YOLOv8 to detect fabric defects in industrial settings.
highlights: Created a large, annotated dataset (~7k textile images) for defect detection.
Designed a CNN-based model architecture inspired by YOLOv8.
Achieved consistent accuracy and performance across validation datasets.

highlights: Built a modular architecture integrating academic, finance, and student data.
Enabled smooth registration, performance tracking, and tuition management.
Improved administrative workflow efficiency across departments.

projects.title: Leather Quality Assessment
projects.description: Implemented machine learning models to evaluate the surface quality of leather. Focused on defect classification and predictive modeling to automate the quality control process in manufacturing.

Automated surface defect classification using computer vision techniques.
Enhanced manufacturing quality assurance and reduced manual inspection time.

projects.title: Vehicle Fuel Consumption Analysis
projects.description: Performed a comprehensive analysis of vehicle types, performance, and fuel efficiency using predictive models. Assessed carbon emissions and alternative fuel options to improve environmental sustainability.
highlights: Analyzed multiple datasets for vehicle types and performance parameters.
Built predictive models for fuel efficiency and emission estimation.
Provided insights on cost optimization and carbon reduction strategies.

projects.title: Mice Protein Expression Analysis
projects.description: This research utilizes the Mice Protein Expression dataset from the UCI Machine Learning Repository to analyze quantitative measurements of 77 proteins in the cerebral cortex of mice across eight experimental groups. The study investigates how genotype, behavioral stimulation, and treatment influence protein expression, using machine learning to identify discriminative biomarkers.
highlights: Performed preprocessing, normalization, and exploratory data analysis on protein datasets.
Applied classification algorithms such as Logistic Regression, KNN, and Random Forest to evaluate predictive performance.
Used PCA and feature selection to identify key proteins linked to neurological and behavioral traits.
Found significant protein subsets with strong discriminative potential as biomarkers for Down Syndrome studies.
